alert.note: Alert for Greene; Monroe; Owen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 7:19PM EST until March 12 at 9:50PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Indiana... White River. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... White River. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Moderate flooding in the Seymour area on the East Fork White River is expected to persist into Thursday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Spencer. * WHEN...Until late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Road south of river gage begins to flood. Gosport Road closes. Extensive agricultural flooding is in progress. Moon Road in very rural northwest Monroe County is extensively flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM EST Tuesday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.2 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Wednesday morning by around 630 AM EST /530 AM CST/.
